questions.question: In digital logic design, what is the primary function of a decoder circuit?
options: To select one of N input lines and direct it to a single output line.
To convert a binary input code into a unique output signal corresponding to the input value.
To store a single bit of data.
To combine multiple input signals into a single output using logical OR operation.
To generate a clock signal from an internal oscillator.

questions.question: In synchronous digital IC design, why is careful handling of Clock Domain Crossing (CDC) signals crucial for circuit correctness?
options: To prevent excessive power consumption due to dynamic voltage scaling.
To ensure all registers are reset synchronously to the same clock edge.
To avoid metastability issues and ensure reliable data transfer between circuits operating with different clock frequencies or phases.
To reduce the total number of metal layers required for routing in the physical design.
To optimize the critical path timing and achieve higher operating frequencies.

questions.question: What is the fundamental difference in how Static Random-Access Memory (SRAM) and Dynamic Random-Access Memory (DRAM) typically store a single bit of data?
options: SRAM uses a magnetic field, while DRAM uses an electrical charge in a capacitor that requires periodic refreshing.
SRAM uses a bistable latch circuit, while DRAM stores charge in a capacitor that requires periodic refreshing.
SRAM uses a charge pump, while DRAM uses a non-volatile flash cell.
SRAM stores data using a network of NOR gates, while DRAM uses a series of shift registers.
SRAM relies on quantum tunneling, whereas DRAM uses electron spin.

questions.question: In a modern pipelined CPU architecture, what is the primary purpose of operand forwarding (also known as bypassing)?
options: To allow instructions to execute out-of-order and commit in-order for precise exceptions.
To predict the outcome of conditional branches and fetch instructions speculatively.
To reduce pipeline stalls by providing results of an instruction directly from an earlier pipeline stage to a dependent instruction in a later stage.
To resolve structural hazards by duplicating functional units.
To prevent cache coherence issues in multi-core systems by ensuring data consistency.

questions.question: What is the primary role of Direct Memory Access (DMA) in a computer system?
options: To translate virtual memory addresses to physical memory addresses.
To manage the allocation and deallocation of processor registers.
To allow I/O devices to transfer data directly to and from main memory without involving the CPU.
To accelerate floating-point arithmetic operations within the CPU.
To ensure data integrity by performing error correction on memory contents.
